de.felix.astar.algorithm

Class Pathfinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.felix.astar.algorithm.Pathfinder

  • public class Pathfinder
extends java.lang.Object
    The Pathfinder class represents a Grid in which the A* algorithm can be executed after setting a start and an end node.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Set<Node> closedCollection
      Stores all closed nodes that are evaluated.

      Whether or not diagonal movement is allowed.

      The end node inside the grid.

      Stores all nodes as a grid.

      The costs for a horizontal or vertical move inside the grid.
      private java.util.PriorityQueue<Node> openCollection
      Stores all open nodes that have to be evaluated.
      private Node startNode
      The starting node inside the grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pathfinder

        public Pathfinder(int rows,
                  int columns,
                  boolean diagonal)
        Creates a new A* Pathfinder. Be advised that the rows and columns in the grid start at zero. So a grid that is 10x10 cannot have a point P(10/10). The point in the bottom right corner of a 10x10 grid would be P(9/9).
        Parameters:
        rows - the amount of rows the grid should have.
        columns - the amount of columns the grid should have.
        diagonal - whether or not the algorithm is allowed to do diagonal steps.

    • Method Detail

      • setNodeType

        public void setNodeType(int x,
                        int y,
                        NodeType nodeType)
        Sets the type of the node at the given coordinates, if they are inside the grid.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate.
        y - the y-coordinate.
        nodeType - the new node type.

      • setNodeType

        public void setNodeType(Node node,
                        NodeType nodeType)
        Sets the type of the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to set its type.
        nodeType - the new type.

      • distance

        private int distance(Node nodeA,
                     Node nodeB)
        Gives the costs of the distance between two nodes using the DIAGONAL_COST and HORIZONTAL_COST constants.
        Parameters:
        nodeA - the first node.
        nodeB - the second node.
        Returns:
        the absolute distance.

      • isInsideGrid

        public boolean isInsideGrid(int x,
                            int y)
        Checks whether or not the given coordinates are inside of the defined grid.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        Returns:
        true, if the point is in the gird, otherwise false.

      • retracePath

        private java.util.List<Node> retracePath()
        Retraces the path from the end to the starting node.
        Returns:
        a list with all nodes of the path.

      • findPath

        public java.util.List<Node> findPath()
        Tries to find the shortest path between the start and the endpoint.

        The returned list contains all nodes that are on the optimal path. The first node is the end node and the last is the starting node.

        Returns:
        If a path was found, a list of all nodes which lead to the target node, otherwise null.

      • setBarrier

        public void setBarrier(int x,
                       int y)
        Marks the node at the given coordinates as a barrier, if the node is inside the grid.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the node.
        y - the y-coordinate of the node.

      • setStartNode

        public void setStartNode(int x,
                         int y)
        Marks the node at the given coordinates as the starting node, if the node is inside the grid. If called multiple times the the old start node is being marked as a normal node normal again.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the node.
        y - the y-coordinate of the node.

      • setEndNode

        public void setEndNode(int x,
                       int y)
        Marks the node at the given coordinates as the end node, if the node is inside the grid. If called multiple times the the old end node is being marked as a normal node normal again.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the node.
        y - the y-coordinate of the node.

      • setDiagonal

        public void setDiagonal(boolean diagonal)
        Sets whether or not the pathfinder is allowed to go in diagonal direction.
        Parameters:
        diagonal - whether diagonal is allowed or not.

      • getStartNode

        public Node getStartNode()
        Getter for the startNode attribute.
        Returns:
        the start node.

        Getter for the endNode attribute.

        Gives the currently used grid.
        Returns:
        the grid.

      • isDiagonal

        public boolean isDiagonal()
        Whether or not the pathfinder allows diagonal movement

        true, if diagonal movement is allowed, otherwise false.
